subtasks: Learn about regenerative farming practices
Understand the impact of traditional agriculture on biodiversity and soil health
Apprehend the importance of soil organisms in nutrient cycling
Implement no-till farming methods to preserve soil structure and microorganisms
Plant cover crops to improve soil health and prevent erosion
Minimize chemical fertilizer use by promoting natural nutrient cycling
Practice rotational grazing to allow grass to reach optimal growth stages
Utilize livestock to contribute to soil organic matter and structure
Study local ecosystems to inform land management decisions
Design and establish a food forest with multiple layers of plants
Foster interdisciplinary relationships between plants, animals, and microorganisms in the agricultural system
